Caravelle Saigon Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1624 reviews

There is good an bad about this place in my opinion. First I will say the good things. The bed is extremely comfortable.

The room is clean. Nice view from the window. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is decent next to the opera house. OK, now here is the bad. The toilet seat did not stay up on it's own (please note I would not complain if this was 3 star place, but for 5 stars I expect better). The temperature would not go below 23c, and I like it to be cold at night. The breakfast was $25 USD per person, so it cost $50 per day. That is way to high for this area and there are no restaurants close to the hotel that I could find for breakfast. In summary, hotel was ok, bed was nice, but there are 4 star places in the area that are just as nice or nicer for 1/2 the price with breakfast included.

Show more
Jus , United States
A&EM Corner Saigon Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 1171 reviews

Prior to checking in we have decided to book another room yet the prices varies so much from the one that is stated on the list on the receptionist desk.

They also kinda "upsell" premium rooms and said that standard rooms are not available yet they are so many when we check in . Front office manager was rude yet impatient with us with ALL our enquiries. Second it was the amenities . All the free snack/chageble items are bundle into one place without any indication of price/sale items.prior checking out the staff insisted that there was a chocolate bar missing yet it's ok on our end it to pay if we consumed it yet price for a bite size sneaker bar was $6US?? It's a ripped off. Night at the hotel was terrible. It's was noisy with the in-house restaurant celebrating a b'day till 2am in the morning while my room just just directly on TOP.. renovation was going on smell of glue us present in our centralised air-con unit. Overall experience was totally bad. Was really dissapointed !!

Show more
Muhammad , Singapore
Roseland Centa Hotel & Spa
8.4 Excellent
Based on 313 reviews

Upon checking-in, I was given a free upgrade to premium deluxe room. But I noticed a slight paint smell in the hotel lobby.

Upon entering the room on the upper floor, I was disturbed by some construction noise as they were building a swimming pool on the 9th floor. The hotel receptionist was kind enough to change my room to the lower floor on the following day, whereby I was finally afforded some peace and quiet from the construction going on at the higher floors. I also noticed the construction workers using the same lift as the hotel guests. As the lift door open, the workers will quickly press the door close button before waiting for hotel guests to enter into the lift. I thought it was a rather peculiar and rude gesture by the workers. I must recommend the breakfast provided by the hotel. The breakfast is amazing with much variety and they make sure to change the breakfast menu every morning. They even have a egg station to cook my favourite sunny side-up eggs. Once, I asked the hotel receptionist for the location of the nearest pharmacy store. Not content with just showing me the direction on the map, hotel staff Mr Khoa even drove me to pick up the medicine using his motorbike. I have stayed in 10 over hotels in District 1 for the past few years, but I have never encountered such personal and amazing service before. Kudos to the hotel staffs Mr Khoa, Mr Hung, Mr Tin and Mr Anh for their professional and friendly service. Just hoped that they can quickly finish the construction on the top floor, so that hotel guests can enjoy a quiet and peaceful stay. I noted that the construction starts from 8am till the evening every day, including Sunday.

Show more
Loo , Singapore
Hotel Nikko Saigon
8.9 Excellent
Based on 3539 reviews

I went business trip to bangkok suddenly so one day before, I booked ticket. I had biggest problem in my life in the saigon hotel.

It was about flight ticket. Because I had to book the ticket for next day. Anyway, I arrived in the hotel 1am check in, and then I asked help for them about booking ticket. There was many many problems and so, 3 staffs didn't sleep at all and tried their best to help me. I was with them with using computer and phone call to airline.They called to airport and airlines and searched the cheapest flight on the many websites. and at the morning 5~6am, all finished. I think it was my biggest terrible mistake to them in my life. But they were very nice kind and tried to help me. and I asked them please sleep and I'll do my own. but They say they are heppy to help me. I'm so much impressed for them and I feel very sorry to them. They are human angels. I aprreciate to you all.

Show more
hyunjee , South Korea
Liberty Central Saigon Citypoint Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1438 reviews

My husband and I traveled to Viet Nam yearly. This is one of the best hotel that we would like to return.

The staff are friendly, facilities are clean, and walking distant to other restaurants. We stayed at Executive room with access to the Executive lounge for 5 days. We enjoyed utilizing the spa room and listening to the music at roof top pool/bar facilities. The Wifi could be improved as it was log out frequently. That was frustrating. The morning buffet is good though I would like the hotel to consider changing/alternate some of the dishes daily. For travelers who stayed at the hotel for the consecutive days, eating the same food every morning can be boring. There's a movie theater at the hotel. We didn't have the chance to watch any movie there. Maybe on our next visit. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would definitely return on our next visit

Show more
Pauline , United States
The Myst Dong Khoi
9 Excellent
Based on 498 reviews

There is nothing we could complain about this impeccably maintained hotel. I think this hotel is brand new, careful attention was paid to every little detail down to the toilet knobs .

The decor , along with everything else in the room was so beautiful ( dark solid wood) that we were afraid to touch or to use them. We almost felt guilty for pulling out the towels or tea sets or trash can to use! Honestly speaking I am afraid how is this hotel will be tested with time, as not all travelers are as careful as we are and the wear and tear could happen faster with this type of decor than with more traditional materials. We are happy to be among their earliest customers as everything is still brand new and fresh! Their staff was really polite and friendly, the breakfast lacks variety every day but has an adequate spread, I love their afternoon 3-5pm complementary sit down snacks ( mini breakfast foods) and live piano player in their beautifully decorated dining room. Too bad we only found out about it on our 4th day. our family just love the swimming pool on the top floor. Again, everything is just beautiful... Please take care of their stuff when you stay there. They do care to make everything special for you!

Show more
quynhnga , United States
Rex Hotel Saigon
8.4 Excellent
Based on 2656 reviews

Customer service was top-notch as were the room and facilities. District 1 is the perfect location for tourists with lots to do within walking distance.

If you love high end shopping, look no further than the hotel lobby or a quick jaunt across the street. The pools and the spa were well maintained and very relaxing places to be. The breakfast, which was included, went beyond my expectations with many choices including an array of fruit juices, breads, fruit, and Vietnamese fare such as pho, noodle, spring rolls etc. there's also an omelet station. Upon check in we were given coupons for welcome cocktails and discounted spa services. Be warned, two people must use the spa and get the same service- not a big deal but good to know. The cocktails are served on the rooftop terrace where a band plays all types of music. The rooms were beyond well-maintained and were very comfortable. The bathrooms were in very good condition with very deep tubs. If you have any mobility issues, hoisting yourself into the tub/shower may be an issue. Toiletries were plentiful without request. The nightly turn-down service with chocolates and an information card were a nice touch. One downside is the noise. The hotel is on a very busy street with LOTS of activity - I mean singing, dancing, construction, you name it - it's a bustling area,. Overall our experience was very pleasant! I'd return again.

Show more
Brandi , United States
New World Saigon Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 2278 reviews

Most of the tourist sites are within 15 minutes walk from the hotel's location. We like the hotel's nice spacious lobby.

Tips: When traveling by Taxi, please note the taxi's number to use for any reporting. Using Uber is cheaper than Taxi. HCMC international airport shops are priced is USD. If you are using Vietnamese Dong for payment, note the currency conversion rate displayed on the cashier's counter. We encountered one cashier using a higher conversion rate on their calculator to bill us. The price was corrected after we highlighted to her.

Show more
George , Singapore
Liberty Central Saigon Riverside Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2180 reviews

We were very pleased with this hotel as it is very conveniently located close to everything we wanted to see in downtown Saigon, yet quiet and peace, as its riverfront location let us feel removed from the hustle & bustle on the streets.

Very happy with the facilities, as they are modern and clean throughout, though the rooftop pool did seem a bit crowded at times, especially in the late afternoon when many guests escaped the heat with a quick dip before heading out for dinner. Breakfast was top notch and all the staff were lovely. If you need to be right downtown, it would be hard to beat this place in value for money.

Show more
Robert , Canada
The Reverie Saigon
9.4 Exceptional
Based on 150 reviews

The decoration of hotel is special ! Very very nice and the service is super good! Since enter the hotel , all the stuff will welcome the customer and they will escort customer to reception and also escort customer until room ! The service is super good, they will give perfect satisfaction to customer, every request from customer they will satisfy u! The body shampoo is Hermes brands! The room super clean , and the food of Chinese restaurant within hotel is very special and very delicious ! The stuff all can speak Cantonese and also very friendly.

The swimming pool is nice and very clean, there is a small pool with warm water ! The special thing is the swimming pool got music to listen !Nearby hotel got many restaurant and there is a big square infront the hotel ! During night time the square is very happening ! Any one who is affordable must try this hotel ! Fully recommended .

Show more
king , Malaysia
Millennium Boutique Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1000 reviews

Positives: The staff is overtly friendly. The rooms and public areas are very clean and relatively new.

The breakfast buffet is one of the best attributes of the hotel. The views from the 11th floor is wonderful. The location is great being located on a dead end street, yet in good walking distance to most District 1 attractions. In the evening, there was a pianist in the lobby, which was a nice touch. It is worth mentioning once again...fantastic and attentive staff. Perhaps the foreigner manager could be more friendly like his staff, but I did not have many dealings with him. He seemed friendly, but nothing like his employees. One final note, the beds are awesome. Negatives: Throughout the hotel, they advertise a happy hour for drinks. It is advertised as buy one drink, get the second for $1.00. I bought a beer and a cocktail. I did expect to pay full price for the more expensive of the two. But, they tried charging me full price for both since one was a beer and one was a cocktail. I was able to finally get the beer for a dollar after a long process of speaking with the manager. They should be more clear in their advertising in this regards. It set a bad tone with me in regards to my overall experience with the hotel. The pool is very small, especially when you look at the hotel next door and see a huge pool. Of course the hotel can not do anything about this. They have very limited space on the roof. The hotel does try to maximize it's seating near the pool, but it feel crowded and uncomfortable. Again, with the space being limited, I understand why they did it. But, it is not comfortable. I made a suggestion to one of the staff that they invest in some fans for the roof area too. When the sun is out and there is minimal wind, it is quite hot in the area. One of the biggest drawbacks for me at this hotel (and I think it is common at most hotels here), you only get about 15 minutes of hot water for a shower before it goes cold. If you have two or more people in

Show more
William , United States
Grand Hotel Saigon
8.4 Excellent
Based on 2095 reviews

This is my 4th Stay in this Hotel. This time I have a very bad experience in the lift. I had a room on the 16th Floor and I was coming down in lobby.

The lift with a big jerk and bang stopped somewhere in the middle. My heart came in my mouth. I pressed the alarm and it took more than 15 minutes by the time the door of the lift was opened by maintenance. I came down in the lobby. I was sweating and no one was to care for me. I wanted to speak to General Manager and was told that he is in meeting. No one offered me a glass of water or nice words. I was told that GM will come back to me. Next 2 days no one responded, no official clarification on what happened in the lift. The situation was surely a life threatening but no one seems to have been bothered. No official apology. It was not expected from the team of Hotel like Grand Hotel where there is huge number of foreigners. It was really scary. This kind of situation needs to be handled in a better manner. It was disappointing, the way the staff handled.

Show more
Anil , India
Windsor Plaza Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1937 reviews

Pleasant memories based on well trained staff who went out of there way to make our stay enjoyable . Sadly the swimming pool was closed for renovations ,which was not spelt out on there web site ,but they solved this problem by taking us daily in there shuttle bus to another of there hotels for the use of that pool.

There is a shuttle bus that operates daily and will do drop offs and pickups at various locations . An excellent buffet breakfast is available and there is a shopping centre attached to the hotel complex . We found the room size was excellent ,in general the complex was clean and tidy although the carpets were in need of a good vacuum. We would recommend this site to other travellers and will stay here again on our return.

Show more
Merl , New Zealand
Liberty Central Saigon Centre Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 2607 reviews

Location was superb! Rooms were clean. Pool was so-so, had a huge tube in the room hence we didnt make a trip up.

Room size however, was completely deceiving from what we booked for. Indicated clearly that we need a double bed (King/Queen) AND a babycot. Apparently, we could have a babycot only in a twin-sized bed for the room category we booked. No where in their website stated so. Mind you, we have a 1 yr old and an older todd. We had 4 rooms in total. And we booked the rooms months in advance and i emailed to reservations Again to remind, that we NEED a double and a cot. The reply came ONLY when we were at the frontdesk. And by the time i've ald wasted 40mins arguing with the FOM with my 2 kids in tow from a 3am flight. Best part, a free upgrade was given to my brother's room coz they requested for a smoking room. Its awesome that the FOM prioritize smokers instead of families. It ended after an almost an hour of debate and me forking out S$300 on top of what we had prepaid. I was a hotelier too btw. And you Ms Front Office Manager spoilt our entire trip.

Show more
SUE , Singapore
Hotel Majestic Saigon
8.5 Excellent
Based on 3704 reviews

The Hotel Majestic Saigon takes you on a trip back in time to the 1920's and the beauty of the art deco era.

It's tasteful opulence provides a memorable and unique experience. From it's sparkling chandeliers to it's embroidered chair cushions, this hotel is pure class. Central to all the major city attractions, the hotel is perfectly positioned for the tourist, and the staff can't do enough for you. Breakfast while looking out over the lake, go site seeing, and then take a leisurely swim to cool off in the court yard pool surrounded by terraces of white balconies over-flowing with green foliage. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Ho Chi Minh City.

Show more
Patricia , Australia
The Luxe Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 2807 reviews

Worst hotel i ever stay.. can't even compare to a no star motel in HCM city. The staffs is unfriendly, the room have ants, the air con for family is totally not cold at all.

the room have paint smell that make us feel dizzy. Booked a family room for 4 adults but all items like shampoo, towels and etc only provide 2. Housekeeping staffs is even worst, when i was leaving my room for check out, the housekeeping staff saw me, she ask me am i checking out, i say yes and he say dun lock the door, she wanted to enter to clean the room. Hello! i haven even check out and let the staff to inspect, if anything lost will still be under my account. I insist not to let her in and lock the door. The worst part is at the lobby which i think is a scam. Every pls beware if you are still booking it or have already booked it. They place a vase on a table in the lobby. the fake flowers is much more bigger than the vase which is very shaky and the flowers is protruding out of the table. I was walk pass it and gently brush against the flower, the whole vase topple no to the floor and break. You can see the happy expression on the staffs face like someone had fall into the trap. The immediately requested me to pay for 600,000VND. I was angry and argue with them, the manager is at the desk and keep speaking vietnamese and insisted me to pay. in the end i paid them 400,000vnd which i think is still overprice for a small vase. But no choice i gonna catch a flight. after payment the staff still can laugh and put the money into their own pocket. I don't understand how could they still be awarded with Agoda Gold Circle awards. If there is no star, i will give ZERO star for this hotel review.

Show more
Edmund , Singapore
Hotel Continental Saigon
8.1 Excellent
Based on 2631 reviews

I chose this hotel mainly because I wanted to see what it is like to stay in a hotel that has such a long history that dates back to the 1880's, and I must say I am glad that I made the right choice.

This hotel definitely has more than met all of my expectations. Even though the hotel and the room may look a bit old when compared to other newer chain hotels (i.e. Marriott or Sheraton), but the Continental exudes an unique kind of elegance and grandeur that cannot be found at these other newer hotels. Everything is solidly built as in the good old days, such as bigger than normal rooms with thick wooden doors, extra long and wide hallways with very high ceilings. We stayed on the third floor with a nice city view, but faces a busy city street, so I was concerned about the street noise. As it turned out, the room was actually very quiet throughout the day or night since the windows were all double paned and provided excellent insulation, so we were all able to sleep like a baby. The hotel service staff were just as excellent, from the front desk, the maid, to the door man. For example, we were asking about good places to eat, and the front desk staff not only gave us the names of recommended restaurants with maps and directions, but they also gave us exact addresses by looking it up on the internet. That is what I call great service! Needless to say, I am very impressed by this hotel, and I would highly recommend it to all who plan to visit Saigon. If I come back, I would surely stay at the Continental again.

Show more
Herman , United States
MerPerle Crystal Palace
8.4 Excellent
Based on 323 reviews

My family and I had 4days 3 nights in this hotel. All the bell boys are so friendly suprisingly they do speaks English and so helpful to us.

Just happy smile all the times .Housekeeping also doing their duties very well. Rooms are perfectly clean. I'm happy enough cause I was travelling with 15months old baby so I was pretty afraid that my room is not properly clean. About the breakfast buffet are kinda limited choices of food. I wish they can keep changing the menu more varieties of choices in future. No doubts the chef are good cook cause room service are great. Miss their salted fried rice. So delicious. This hotel is highly recommended... And surely will be back for the next visit.

Show more
Toh , Malaysia
Cititel Central Saigon Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 1384 reviews

I stayed here for 5 days. All was good but my room location had wifi that was not reliable. I was offered to change room but declined.

I commented better feng shui NOT to have wifi in my room... better rest and could go to lobby or breakfast area if needed. Considering I come from the High Tech industry, I appreciated not having a device in room to draw my attention. Bed was quite comfortable and all power worked (except room wifi) Breakfast had varied dishes each day but also some items the same. I found this to be quite good. Maybe toned down for chilies based on euro/American tastes... ironically, being from the US am addicted to chilies that would kill most Thai or Viet eaters... but understand mainstream aversion to "spicy". The staff in general was very helpful and pleasant. From this perspective, Vietnam is a great place to be, this hotel was no exception. Location was quite good... not being in backpacker hell of District 1. Also, was quick walk to Ben Thanh market... plenty of places within walking distance!

Show more
Robert , United States
Silverland Central Hotel & Spa
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4072 reviews

I had stayed for only a night as it was my first trip to HCM, so I had planned a night stay in different accommodations.

=) Location:- Strategic! It's just next to Ben Thanh Market, and only 30mins away from the airport! From the back exit of the hotel, it leads you to the night market! Wow, love that! There are plenty of restaurants, cafes, shops around the hotel. Service:- I want to specially commendate Chris (his Vietnamese name had a "Minh" in it) - the front desk reception personnel. All the hotel staffs were all smiles and very approachable. Chris was exceptional because he remembered my room number when I requested for an extended checkout time the next morning! I find that act was a personal touch to my experience. The response in providing the bath towel was very prompt despite my request at about near midnight on the night I was there. =D Cleaniness:- Good! It's very important to me to have a clean toilet and a clean bed! After a night stay in a capsule hotel and a a/c dorm in Longson, the stay in Silverland was considered a luxury! Facilities:- Honestly, not much time to explore the hotel. In the Superior room, I was happy enough to have a kettle to boil water, a hair dryer, a cable TV (it had HBO! NAT GEO! Yayyy!), double bed, cupboard with many hangers, safe, "PUMA" in room slippers, basic toiletries~ Space:- Not one who needs a lot of space, find the Superior room good enough for a solo traveler or a couple. Compact and comfortable sums it up! Others:- Breakfast is a standard selection with local foods included, I like my breakfast simple with the basics. The hotel serves it, along with smiley staffs! Oh by the way, the room wasn't sound proof or perhaps, the other hotel guests were just being inconsiderate to make a lot of noise after midnight at the corridor~ =b Will I re-visit it? OF COURSE, I will! =)

7.9 Very good

The hotel is located in Saigon Backpackers'/Foreigners' Town (Tây Phố), a hotspot for tourists to visit or stay in Vietnam.

Less than a kilometer from the center of it all Bến Thành market and covers only a couple of square miles, the tiny "town" that never sleeps is home to over 200 hotels/guest rooms, about a hundred travel ofices, and numerous restaurants, convenience stores, pharmacies, fashion and gift shops, massage parlors, money exchange offices, and you name it. Starbucks, too! Nighttime is prime time, a great nightlife adventure for everyone coming to town. A lot of people like it and still a lot don't, of course -- "beauty is in the eyes of the be(er)holder". Most beer on the street is less than a dollar a bottle, cold or iced. The hotel actually is located on the borderline, not in the middle, of the town so you can rest or sleep when you choose to and be able to -- in the town that never does. How good is this hotel? Last year I stayed here for a total of... a little over 6 months. 6 months, instead of a planned few weeks. Location and convenience: you can find almost anything and everything in walking distance. Fantastic value for money: room was very clean, spacious enough and with great views. Strong and stable WiFi. But the staff is its most valuable asset: warm, courteous, affluent in English and extremely friendly and helpful; they went to great lengths to help with whatever their guests need to know/do. Each and everyone of them. Especially Kenny, the manager; and Dương, a senior staff member. This hotel has become my home whenever I came to Saigon.

We've never done a review for anywhere before but for Sam's we really feel people should know how lovely his place is.

It's a quiet homestay about a 20 minute ride from the city or a couple of buses which is super easy to do and more of an experience. We didn't come to Vietnam to stay in the middle of Ho Chi Minh where it's a little too crazy and truly not much of a cultural experience so Sam's was the perfect place and super chilled. The rooms are all bedrooms in his home and much cleaner and more specious then any hostel you'll stay in, especially for the price you pay, and with good warm showers. His whole family are honestly the nicest people and if you treat them with kindness you won't be let down on your experience here. His mum and wife make the best food, we even got to make our own rice paper rolls (spring rolls). The house is usually quiet throughout the day and you can rent a bike and head out around this time or relax. The local shops and street food are much cheaper than in the city and there's very few tourists around this area so we were given the opportunity to improve on our Vietnamese! We bought a bike off Sam and he offers to fix any faults you may notice at his local mechanic before you head off on your journey and he really wants to help in any kind of way like with directions, touristic places or just any info. Another great thing is that Sam teaches english to the local kids so between 5-7ish they'll be around the house and sitting down with them to speak a bit of english or read a book is a cool experience :) We couldn't thank Sam enough because it's good to have someone to trust especially when you're travelling so we 100% recommend anyone to stay here because we'll definitely be back next time we're down south!!

Traveler impressions of Ho Chi Minh City

HCMC is a busy, crowded, polluted city. There is not that much that redeems the city other than the Vietnam War exhibits and historical aspect.

As is true in most of Vietnam, pedestrians must dodge the never-ending motorcycles and cars as pedestrians are at the bottom of the food chain. You learn quickly how to dodge though and somehow it works. Actually the traffic might be one of the most amazing things about the city. Service in most restaurants and elsewhere is confusing. Service staff seems indifferent but actually, I think it is a cultural thing - they wait for your cue - so don't be shy, call out to your wait person when you need them. Vendors on the other hand are just the opposite. They pay attention to you....too much. I have traveled to many places and although I certainly didn't hate HCMC, it was not a favorite. If you are visiting Vietnam, you would do yourself a favor to get out of HCMC and go visit some of the smaller cities/villages in the middle and north of the country.

More about Ho Chi Minh City

Sitting on the banks of the Saigon River, Ho Chi Minh City is the largest city in Vietnam. The city, also known as Saigon, is served by Tan Son Nhat Airport which is only around 15 minutes from central Ho Chi Minh City by taxi. Hotels near Tan Son Nhat Airport usually cater to business guests, but leisure travelers will find the accommodations equally as suitable.

There's a lot to see and do in Ho Chi Minh City. Owing to former French occupation, the city was once referred to as the Pearl of the East and architectural remnants of its colonial past remain. Most notable are the Notre Dame Cathedral and the Saigon Opera House, both located in the city center. A lot of Ho Chi Minh City's tourist attractions are historical, and many of them focus on the Vietnam War. Reunification Palace, commonly known as Independence Palace, is a restored building largely unchanged from when the North Vietnamese army crashed through the gates and took control of the city.

Nearby, at the Museum of Vietnamese History, a large collection of Vietnamese artifacts and antiques are on display. For the nature enthusiasts, the botanical gardens serve as a great way to escape the noise of the city and focusing on natural beauty. A popular way to find respite from Vietnam's heat is at Dam Sen Water Park, located right in the city center. Ho Chi Minh City is a place of historic and cultural significance, where every street reminds the traveler of all the events that have taken place in this city. A visit to Vietnam would hardly be complete without a stroll around Saigon.

on 1523 reviews Traveler impressions of Ho Chi Minh City HCMC is a busy, crowded, polluted city. There is not that much that redeems the city other than the Vietnam War exhibits and historical aspect. As is true in most of Vietnam, pedestrians must dodge the never-ending motorcycles and cars as pedestrians are at the bottom of the food chain. You learn quickly how to dodge though and somehow it works. Actually the traffic might be one of the most amazing things about the city. Service in most restaurants and elsewhere is confusing. Service staff seems indifferent but actually, I think it is a cultural thing - they wait for your cue - so don't be shy, call out to your wait person when you need them. Vendors on the other hand are just the opposite. They pay attention to you....too much. I have traveled to many places and although I certainly didn't hate HCMC, it was not a favorite. If you are visiting Vietnam, you would do yourself a favor to get out of HCMC and go visit some of the smaller cities/villages in the middle and north of the country. All manner of amazing sights appear in the ordinary everyday life of the vietnamese Show more Graham ,Australia Take only the 2 branded taxis, the rest will take you for a good ride and frisk you off, speak to any Vietnamese and you will hear that everyone has encountered crimes or criminals. This city is all a terrible mess and badly requires a make over. Show more Chan ,Singapore I found Independence Palace - especially the presidential war room down in the basement bunker fascinating. Being able to walk in the footsteps of history was amazing. To be able to see the gates where the Viet Cong tanks crashed through, stand on the balcony where the Viet Cong waved their flags and see where the president lived was fabulous. Make the trip to Cu Chi to see the famous Viet Cong tunnels and it will really put the war into perspective for you. Also I highly recommend catching the hydrofoil from Ho Chi Minh City (District 4) for the 90 minute trip up the Mekong River to beachside Vung Tau. Show more Crothers ,Australia Despite the quantity of motorbikes, is well organized within the population. We can survive easily with this amazing traffic. Schultz ,Brazil It is a very boring place. All historical sites can be seen in one day and there is nothing more to do. Compared to Thailand, there are almost no religious buildings for their architecture, shopping is pretty limited, no large supermarkets in the center, no night life, banks and money exchanges close early. It is, after all, a communist country. The best thing to do is to spend one day in the city and two days on a Mekong Delta trip. One day trip is not recommended as most of the time will be spent on the bus and a two day trip offers much more activities. Show more Zakashansky ,United States Ho Chi Minh City is fast becoming a vibrant metropolis with up-and-coming modern infrastructure like the rail transport system that is being constructed. Malaysians, especially Muslim women, thoroughly enjoy the shopping for fine and delicate Muslim fashion apparels which cost a fraction of the price they would pay at home, such as hijab, dresses etc. Other things worth looking out for is fruits and nuts and some say coffee, but personally I found the Vietnamese brew to bit a tad too strong for my taste. Show more Baharudin ,Malaysia HCM is transitioning fast to a modern city. Do come early before all the charm is gone. The Times Square is a wonderful place to hangout with a large area for pedestrians to hangout surrounded by 2 busy roads. My kids say they are playing a real life 'Crossy Road' overtime we need to cross the roads. Traffic is chaotic but it is part of the charm of the city. Make sure you are visible before proceeding to calm cross the road at a constant pace. The vehicles will notice you and adjust accordingly Show more Low ,Malaysia A laidback city. Cheap buys around the markets. But felt unsafe. Plenty of roadside snatch theft happening in broad daylight. Locals did nothing to help. Show more Zainal Abidin ,Singapore prices are not expensive here. You can pamper yourself with massage, spa. spend time in travelling and know vietnamese war history. Devina ,India Relatively safe but exercise caution. Not expensive but a bit touristy. Lots of things to do and many districts. Taking a taxi (Mahlinh/Vinasun) during non peak hours is reasonable (but have a knowledge of how far you are going). Ben Thanh market is a favorite but take note there are fixed and non-fixed priced (bargainable) shops. Also quality of goods can differ from one place to the other (especially lacquer-ware). Stay polite, cool, and keep your wits about you and you will enjoy Saigon, although the traffic is something else - much worse than Bangkok, similar to Jakarta. No shame in pitching the opening price of anything at double what it would cost the Vietnamese. The city, also known as Saigon, is served by Tan Son Nhat Airport which is only around 15 minutes from central Ho Chi Minh City by taxi. Hotels near Tan Son Nhat Airport usually cater to business guests, but leisure travelers will find the accommodations equally as suitable. There's a lot to see and do in Ho Chi Minh City. Owing to former French occupation, the city was once referred to as the Pearl of the East and architectural remnants of its colonial past remain. Most notable are the Notre Dame Cathedral and the Saigon Opera House, both located in the city center. A lot of Ho Chi Minh City's tourist attractions are historical, and many of them focus on the Vietnam War. Reunification Palace , commonly known as Independence Palace, is a restored building largely unchanged from when the North Vietnamese army crashed through the gates and took control of the city. Nearby, at the Museum of Vietnamese History, a large collection of Vietnamese artifacts and antiques are on display. For the nature enthusiasts, the botanical gardens serve as a great way to escape the noise of the city and focusing on natural beauty. A popular way to find respite from Vietnam's heat is at Dam Sen Water Park, located right in the city center. Ho Chi Minh City is a place of historic and cultural significance, where every street reminds the traveler of all the events that have taken place in this city. A visit to Vietnam would hardly be complete without a stroll around Saigon.
